channel.title: Enviromental variables
channel.description:
ok so i had a problem with my client, i use windows 7 and everytime i went on my client, when i clicked on the map or screen it would cut out, so i looked at whether or not other people have had the same problem and it said my enviromental variables were wrong or i didnt have jdk,
after that i re-did my enviromental variables, which were wrong... and looked for a java update, i have jdk 6 update 18 and thats what my enviromental variables are also set at so i dont know where i am going wrong,
also what is jdk 7? will that help me with my windows 7 problem?
please help :(

item.title: Enviromental variables
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

lol… from the normal java website…

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

Read full topic

item.title: Enviromental variables
item.dc:creator: @owner_alex1 owner alex1
item.description:
@owner_alex1 wrote:

which jdk do i download though? theres so many, could you send me a link? because some come in a package download and all that, its annoying

Read full topic

item.title: Enviromental variables
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

Just delete and re-download the new jdk, it auto sets your variables in the installation.

Read full topic
